ai-sn33:1.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-sn33:1.1.2_0: Then the wanderer Vacchagotta went up to the Buddha.
ai-sn33:1.1.3_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.
ai-sn33:1.1.3_1: Then the wanderer Vacchagotta said to the Buddha:
ai-sn33:1.1.4_0: “What is the cause, Master Gotama, what is the reason why these various misconceptions arise in the world? That is:
ai-sn33:1.1.5_0: the cosmos is eternal, or not eternal, or finite, or infinite; the soul and the body are the same thing, or they are different things; after death, a Realized One exists, or doesn’t exist, or both exists and doesn’t exist, or neither exists nor doesn’t exist.”
ai-sn33:1.1.6_0: “Vaccha, it is because of not knowing form, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation
ai-sn33:1.1.7_0: that these various misconceptions arise in the world.
ai-sn33:1.1.9_0: after death, a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist.
ai-sn33:1.1.10_0: This is the cause, this is the reason.”
ai-sn33:1.1.11_0: the cosmos is eternal, or not eternal ...
ai-sn33:1.1.12_0: after death, a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist.”
ai-sn33:2.1.2_0: Then the wanderer Vacchagotta said to the Buddha:

ai-sn33:2.1.4_0: the cosmos is eternal, or not eternal ...
ai-sn33:2.1.5_0: after death, a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist.”

ai-sn33:2.1.10_0: This is the cause, this is the reason.”
ai-sn33:2.1.11_0: the cosmos is eternal, or not eternal ...
ai-sn33:2.1.12_0: after death, a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist.”

ai-sn33:55.1.2_0: “Vaccha, it is because of not directly experiencing consciousness, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation ...”

ai-sn33:55.1.9_0: The first sub-chapter on Vacchagotta is finished.
ai-sn33:55.2.5_0: at the moment of actual absorption, without consciousness,
ai-sn33:55.2.7_0: The Linked Discourses with Vacchagotta are completed.
